personas.name: Stressed Daughter
opening_lines: Oh hi, yes I did fill something in online… I'm not even sure where to start though.
Right, yes — someone at the hospital mentioned you and I put my details in. I need help quite urgently.

relative.situation: Had a fall last week, currently in hospital but due to be discharged soon.

personas.caller_context: Works full-time in marketing. Lives 45 minutes from mum. Has a younger brother who lives abroad and isn't much help. Feels guilty about not visiting more.
hidden_needs: Hasn't told mum she's looking into care — worried she'll resist.
Budget is a concern but not the primary worry.
Needs reassurance that she's not abandoning her mum.
Wants someone to tell her it's okay to ask for help.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Opens up about guilt and family dynamics. May get emotional.
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Goes quiet, says 'I need to think about it', tries to end the call.
behaviour_triggers.empathy_shown: Shares that mum also has mild memory issues she hasn't mentioned yet.

personas.name: Researching Son
opening_lines: Hi there. I've been looking at a few providers and I have some questions.
Hello, I've done quite a bit of research already. Can you walk me through how you compare to Home Instead?

relative.situation: Early-stage dementia diagnosed 6 months ago. Currently managing at home but incidents are increasing.

personas.caller_context: Works in finance. Analytical, has a spreadsheet comparing 5 providers. Has spoken to 3 competitors already. Lives nearby and visits daily after work.
hidden_needs: Wants to feel in control of the decision.
Distrusts anything that sounds like a sales pitch.
Secretly terrified about the dementia progression.
Needs detailed facts, not emotional reassurance.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Engages deeply, asks increasingly specific follow-up questions.
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Becomes combative. Says 'That's what the last company said too.'
behaviour_triggers.given_data: Respects the salesperson and lowers guard if given specific, honest comparisons.

personas.name: Reluctant Spouse
opening_lines: A friend of ours suggested I give you a call. I'm not sure we really need this.
Hello. I'm just… looking into options. My wife's had an operation and we might need a bit of help.

relative.situation: Recovering from hip replacement surgery. Expected 6-8 week recovery period.

personas.caller_context: Retired teacher, 75. Has always been the primary caregiver. Very proud and independent. Finds it hard to accept help from strangers.
hidden_needs: Needs the salesperson to normalise accepting care without making him feel old or incapable.
Worried about a stranger in the house.
Concerned about cost on a pension.
Doesn't want to feel like he's failed his wife.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Gradually shares more about his own health struggles (bad back, fatigue).
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Becomes defensive. Says 'We've managed fine for 50 years.'
behaviour_triggers.dignity_preserved: Warms up significantly if the salesperson frames care as supporting him, not replacing him.

personas.name: Overwhelmed Granddaughter
opening_lines: Oh hello — yes, my mum registered online but she's not great with phones so she asked me to handle it. It's about my nan.
Hi, yeah I think my mum put our details in. I'm sort of dealing with this on behalf of the family. We're a bit all over the place to be honest.

relative.situation: Increasingly frail, living alone. Had two minor falls in the past month. Refuses to move into a care home.

personas.caller_context: 25 years old, working as a junior teacher. Has become the default family coordinator because she's 'good with admin'. Mum and uncle are in conflict about what to do. Nobody has power of attorney sorted.
hidden_needs: Feels out of her depth — she's making decisions that should be made by her parents.
Needs someone to simplify the options, not add complexity.
Wants to be taken seriously despite her age.
Secretly worried nan might not be safe living alone right now.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Relieved to talk to someone calm. Shares the family conflict openly.
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Panics. Says 'I need to check with my mum first' and retreats.
behaviour_triggers.patronised: Shuts down immediately if spoken to like she doesn't understand.
behaviour_triggers.taken_seriously: Becomes highly engaged and asks for clear next steps she can relay to the family.

personas.name: Long-Distance Son
opening_lines: Oh great, thanks for getting back to me. I'm actually based in Dubai — my mum's in Bristol and I'm worried about her.
Hi yes, I registered on your site. I live overseas so I'm trying to sort care for my mother remotely, which isn't easy.

relative.situation: Diagnosed with Parkinson's 2 years ago. Has a part-time carer 3 days a week but needs more support. Neighbour called him last week concerned.

personas.caller_context: Expat professional, 52. Earns well but is consumed by guilt about being far away. Has a sister in the UK but they don't get along — she thinks he's 'throwing money at the problem'.
hidden_needs: Needs to feel he's doing the right thing from a distance.
Wants a provider he can trust to keep him informed without him having to chase.
Budget is not an issue but value matters — doesn't want to be overcharged because he's overseas.
Needs help navigating the sibling tension around care decisions.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Opens up about the sibling conflict and his guilt.
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Suspicious. Says 'I've been quoted all sorts of numbers by other companies.'
behaviour_triggers.trust_built: Asks detailed questions about communication — updates, reporting, escalation procedures.

personas.name: Professional Advocate
opening_lines: Hello, I'm a social worker. I have a client who might benefit from your service.
Hi, I work for the local authority. I'm exploring live-in care options for one of my clients.

relative.situation: Recently discharged from hospital after a stroke. Limited family support. Council-funded care package is being reviewed.

personas.caller_context: Experienced social worker, handles dozens of cases. Has used agency care before and been disappointed. Tight on time and expects efficient, knowledgeable responses.
hidden_needs: Needs to tick boxes for the local authority — safeguarding, CQC status, insurance.
Wants to know if Elder can work within a mixed-funding model (part council, part private).
Values efficiency over warmth — doesn't need empathy, needs competence.
Will become a repeat referral source if impressed.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Appreciates being asked about the client's specific needs rather than given a generic pitch.
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Cuts the call short. Says 'I'll add you to the list and compare.'
behaviour_triggers.competence_shown: Engages deeper, asks about onboarding timelines and carer matching process.
behaviour_triggers.waffle_detected: Interrupts and redirects. Has no patience for vague answers.

personas.name: Second-Time Caller
opening_lines: Oh right, yes — I actually registered a few weeks ago but wasn't ready then. Things have changed.
Hi, yeah I think I spoke to someone there before but I can't remember their name. My situation's got worse since then.

relative.situation: Advanced COPD. Was managing with daily visits from local agency but they've just cancelled the contract with 2 weeks notice.

personas.caller_context: Daughter, 58. Registered interest with Elder 3 weeks ago but decided to stick with existing agency. Now that agency has pulled out and she's under time pressure. Feeling angry and let down by the care system.
hidden_needs: Needs speed but is wary of making another bad decision.
Wants to understand what makes Elder different from the agency that just let her down.
Needs to feel heard — she's been through a lot and doesn't want to repeat her story for the tenth time.
Concerned about continuity — terrified of another provider disappearing.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Lets her guard down. Shares how exhausted and angry she is.
behaviour_triggers.hard_sell: Explodes. 'This is exactly what the last lot did — promised the world and then vanished.'
behaviour_triggers.acknowledged_frustration: Calms down significantly if the salesperson validates her experience before offering solutions.
behaviour_triggers.rushed: Becomes more anxious. Needs the salesperson to slow down despite the urgency.

personas.name: End-of-Life Daughter
opening_lines: Hi… sorry, this is hard. My dad's been told he has a few months left.
Hello. I'm looking into palliative care at home. The hospital said live-in care might be an option.

relative.situation: Terminal lung cancer. Has chosen to stop treatment. Wants to spend remaining time at home. Currently in hospital but wants to be discharged.

personas.caller_context: Daughter, 48. Close to her dad. Has taken compassionate leave from work. Mum passed away 3 years ago. Has a teenage son who is struggling with the news.
hidden_needs: This is deeply emotional — she may cry or need pauses in the conversation.
Needs to know Elder can handle end-of-life care specifically, not just general elderly care.
Wants to understand how carers are supported too — doesn't want someone in her home who can't cope.
Needs speed — dad could be discharged in days.
Price is genuinely secondary. Dignity and comfort are everything.

behaviour_triggers.good_discovery: Deeply grateful. Will share personal details about her dad's wishes.
behaviour_triggers.sensitivity_shown: Asks increasingly specific questions about palliative training, night care, and GP liaison.
